input.text_prompt:
System / Context:
You are an expert Senior Java Software Engineer specializing in desktop application development using JavaFX 25 and Java 24. Your task is to generate a production-ready, fully functional desktop application based on the provided Technical Specifications, Functional Requirements, and UI Assets.
Technical Constraints & Environment:
JDK Version: Java 24.
Library: OpenJFX 25.0.1.
Build Tool: Maven 3.9.11.
Database: MySQL 8.0.43 via JDBC.
Code Completeness: You must provide the full, compilable source code. Do not use placeholders like // ... rest of code. Do not omit imports.
Visuals: Do not use external image files (PNG/JPG).
Project Scope:
Application Name: Quiz App
Description:
Section 1: Functional Requirements:
Implement the following logic strictly. The code must satisfy every ID listed below:
FR1.1: The system must display a list of available quiz topics
FR1.2: The user must be able to select only one topic at a time.
FR1.3: Upon selection of a topic, the system must navigate the user to the Quiz View screen for the selected topic.
FR1.4: The list of topics must be dynamically loaded from a backend source (database/API).
FR2.1: The system must display the quiz questions one by one.
FR2.2: The system must display the current question number (e.g., "Question 1", “Question 2”).
FR2.3: Each question must have a body of text/content.
FR2.4: Each question must be presented with four answer options.
FR2.5: The user must be able to select only one answer option per question.
FR2.6: The selected answer must be clearly highlighted or marked.
FR2.7: The user must be able to navigate to the next question using a "Next" control.
FR2.8: The user must be able to navigate to the previous question using a "Previous" control.
FR2.9: When a question is first viewed, no option should be pre-selected unless the user has already answered it.
FR2.10: Upon reaching the last question and clicking "Next" (or an equivalent control like "Submit"), the system must process the quiz and navigate the user to the Results screen.
FR2.11: The "Previous" control must be disabled or hidden on the first question.
FR2.12: The "Next" control should change to "Submit" on the last question.
FR3.1: The system must calculate and display the user's final score (number of correct answers).
FR3.2: The system must display the score as a ratio of correct answers to the total number of questions (e.g., "Score: 9/10").
FR3.3: The user must be presented with an option to select a different topic using a clearly labeled button (e.g., "Select Different Topic").
FR3.4: Clicking the "Select Different Topic" button must navigate the user back to the Topic Selection screen.
Section 2: UI & Wireframe Specifications:
The GUI must strictly adhere to the attached visual wireframe.
Layout Structure:
The application is structured into three distinct pages, all featuring a dark purple background with white text and contrasting white/light purple UI elements. All dynamic content, including topic titles, question text, options, and the final score is expected to be fetched from a database or calculated by the backend.
Topic Selection Page
Title: "Select Topic"
Elements: Three large, white, rounded vertically stacked buttons (e.g., Topic A, Topic B, Topic C) for user choice.
Quiz View Page
Title: "Question #" (e.g., "Question 1")
Question Area: Question text displayed in a distinct lighter purple rectangular box.
Input: Four vertically stacked radio buttons for multiple-choice selection.
Navigation: Small links/buttons for < Previous and Next > (or Submit on the final question).
Result Page
Display: Prominent text showing the final score (e.g., "Score: 9/10").
Action: A large white button labeled "Select Different Topic".
Styling: Strictly mimic the color palette, typography, corner roundness, and element spacing visible in the attached wireframe image. The visual output should look as close to the image as possible.
Window Size: 1440 width x 1024 height.
Section 3: Database Configuration:
use the following configurations:
URL: jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/quiz_app_db
User: root
Password: 1234
Schema:
USE quiz_app_db; CREATE TABLE Topics ( topic_id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTO_INCREMENT, topic_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL UNIQUE ); CREATE TABLE Questions ( question_id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTO_INCREMENT, topic_id INTEGER NOT NULL, question_text TEXT NOT NULL, option_a VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL, option_b VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL, option_c VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL, option_d VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL, correct_answer CHAR(1) NOT NULL, FOREIGN KEY (topic_id) REFERENCES Topics(topic_id) ON DELETE CASCADE, CHECK (correct_answer IN ('A', 'B', 'C', 'D'))
);
Output Deliverables:
Provide the output in the following format:
pom.xml: Complete Maven configuration.
Main.java: The entry point extending Application.
Controller/View Classes: If separating concerns, provide clearly marked files.
styles.css: (If used).

execution.failure_reason: COMPILATION FAILURE, Maven could not resolve the required MySQL dependency
execution.failure_log:
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal on project quiz-app: Could not resolve dependencies for project com.quizapp:quiz-app:jar:1.0-SNAPSHOT

[ERROR] dependency: mysql:mysql-connector-j:jar:8.3.0 (compile)

[ERROR]         Could not find artifact mysql:mysql-connector-j:jar:8.3.0 in central (https://repo.maven.apache.org/maven2)

input.text_prompt:
The application failed to compile. Maven could not resolve the required MySQL dependency:
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal on project quiz-app: Could not resolve dependencies for project com.quizapp:quiz-app:jar:1.0-SNAPSHOT
[ERROR] dependency: mysql:mysql-connector-j:jar:8.3.0 (compile)
[ERROR]         Could not find artifact mysql:mysql-connector-j:jar:8.3.0 in central (https://repo.maven.apache.org/maven2)
Please analyze this dependency error and regenerate the updated files required to fix this compilation issue

output.text_response:
The error occurs because the Maven coordinates for the MySQL connector changed in recent versions. The Group ID was incorrectly set to `mysql` instead of the newer `com.mysql`.

Here are the corrected files to resolve the dependency and compilation errors.

### 1. Updated Maven Configuration (`pom.xml`)

I have corrected the `groupId` for the MySQL dependency to `com.mysql`.

```xml pom.xml
<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"
         xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
         xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>

    <groupId>com.quizapp</groupId>
    <artifactId>quiz-app</artifactId>
    <version>1.0-SNAPSHOT</version>

    <properties>
        <project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
        <maven.compiler.release>24</maven.compiler.release>
        <javafx.version>25.0.1</javafx.version>
    </properties>

    <dependencies>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.openjfx</groupId>
            <artifactId>javafx-controls</artifactId>
            <version>${javafx.version}</version>
        </dependency>
        <!-- Corrected Dependency Coordinates -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.mysql</groupId>
            <artifactId>mysql-connector-j</artifactId>
            <version>8.3.0</version>
        </dependency>
    </dependencies>

    <build>
        <plugins>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>3.13.0</version>
                <configuration>
                    <release>24</release>
                    <compilerArgs>
                        <arg>--enable-preview</arg>
                    </compilerArgs>
                </configuration>
            </plugin>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.openjfx</groupId>
                <artifactId>javafx-maven-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>0.0.8</version>
                <configuration>
                    <mainClass>com.quizapp.QuizApp</mainClass>
                </configuration>
            </plugin>
        </plugins>
    </build>
</project>
```

### 2. Updated Module Info (`src/main/java/module-info.java`)

The module name for the new MySQL connector is `com.mysql.connector.j`.

```java src/main/java/module-info.java
module com.quizapp {
    requires javafx.controls;
    requires java.sql;
    
    // Updated module requirement for the new connector
    requires com.mysql.connector.j;

    exports com.quizapp;
}
```

execution.failure_reason: COMPILATION FAILURE, The model used an incorrect module name in module-info.java

input.text_prompt:
The application failed to compile. The Java Module System cannot resolve the MySQL dependency:
[ERROR] /D:/LLM_JavaFX_Thesis/data/generated_code_repo/Quiz App/Gemini/src/main/java/module-info.java:[6,33] module not found: com.mysql.connector.j
Please analyze this module error and regenerate the updated files required to fix this compilation issue.

output.text_response:
The compilation error occurs because the **Java Module System (JPMS)** name for the MySQL Connector is `mysql.connector.j`, not `com.mysql.connector.j`.

Even though the Maven Group ID is `com.mysql`, the `Automatic-Module-Name` defined inside the JAR's manifest is `mysql.connector.j`.

Here are the corrected files to resolve this specific module resolution error.

### 1. Updated Module Info (`src/main/java/module-info.java`)

I have updated the `requires` directive to use the correct module name.

```java src/main/java/module-info.java
module com.quizapp {
    requires javafx.controls;
    requires java.sql;
    
    // Correct module name for com.mysql:mysql-connector-j artifact
    requires mysql.connector.j;

    exports com.quizapp;
}
```

### 2. Maven Configuration (`pom.xml`)

Ensuring the dependency coordinates strictly match the connector version that provides this module name.

```xml pom.xml
<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"
         xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
         xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>

    <groupId>com.quizapp</groupId>
    <artifactId>quiz-app</artifactId>
    <version>1.0-SNAPSHOT</version>

    <properties>
        <project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
        <maven.compiler.release>24</maven.compiler.release>
        <javafx.version>25.0.1</javafx.version>
    </properties>

    <dependencies>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.openjfx</groupId>
            <artifactId>javafx-controls</artifactId>
            <version>${javafx.version}</version>
        </dependency>
        <!-- This artifact provides the module: mysql.connector.j -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.mysql</groupId>
            <artifactId>mysql-connector-j</artifactId>
            <version>8.3.0</version>
        </dependency>
    </dependencies>

    <build>
        <plugins>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>3.13.0</version>
                <configuration>
                    <release>24</release>
                    <compilerArgs>
                        <arg>--enable-preview</arg>
                    </compilerArgs>
                </configuration>
            </plugin>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.openjfx</groupId>
                <artifactId>javafx-maven-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>0.0.8</version>
                <configuration>
                    <mainClass>com.quizapp.QuizApp</mainClass>
                </configuration>
            </plugin>
        </plugins>
    </build>
</project>
```
